3.3 Pyrexia of unknown origin (PUO) 
Type of Infection 
First Line (with Dosage and 
Duration) 
Comments 
PUO 
No antibiotics suggested 
unless the patient has 
features of sepsis 
 
Empiric antimicrobial therapy is generally 
not recommended for treating pyrexia of 
unknown origin (PUO) as it can delay the 
evaluation for the cause of the fever. Needs 
work up for infectious & non-infectious 
causes. 
For common etiological agents of Pyrexia of unknown origin, see Annexure B.3.3 
References: 
1. Fernandez C, Beeching NJ. Pyrexia of unknown origin. Clin Med (Lond). 2018;18(2):170-174. 
doi:10.7861/clinmedicine.18-2-170 
2. Varghese G M, Trowbridge P, Doherty T. Investigating and managing pyrexia of unknown origin 
in adults BMJ 2010; 341: c5470 doi:10.1136/bmj.c5470
